column4: the networking icon in my gnome-panel always shows a cross as if its not connected to internet even when I am connected.
it possible that it's showing that status for another network card which isn't connected; try double-clicking the icon for more, or right-clicking it, etc
when I click "Connection information" it says no valid connections found..
YMMV, but i had to erase the existing (default) profile in networkmanager, then create one (i use static IP) for my LAN connection.
